intro: Oreobroma yosemitanum, commonly known as the Yosemite rockscale, is a rare flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is protected under federal and state conservation laws.
